intro: Chiococca vestita var. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth chiococca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
